basics.name: Franco G. Riberi
basics.label: Full Stack Developer
basics.summary: Hi, I’m Franco Riberi. I’m passionate about what I do. Nothing is more fulfilling than being part of a team with similar interests, and an organization that lues its employees. I’m a hands-on, highly competent software engineer with more than five years of experience in designing, programming and testing software. I have experience with software development life cycle complemented by a proven ability to quickly assimilate and rapidly utilize new technologies. Over the past years I have continuously challenged myself with new languages, frameworks and methodologies. My core languages have always been C++ and python but I have also worked as a full stack developer as a freelancer. I have a very strong interest in full stack javascript development and have recently been experimenting with Meteor and React as well as Typescript. As a professional, I’m always looking for the highest quality in the products that I’m involved. I consider myself avery proactive and dynamic person that enjoys teamwork and challenges.

highlights.title: Detection of Maritime Anomalies
highlights.description: I’m responsible for the analysis, design, development and testing of the project. I have started with the requirement analysis and prototyping in python. Next steps include the development in C++. Activities include: architecture and design of all the system, project planning, analysis application, development and technical coordination of the team. Technologies: waf, python, numpy, scipy, h5py, gdal, pytest, mock, pep8, pylint, C++, C++11, opencv, gtest, valgrind, lcov, gdb, cppcheck.

highlights.title: Internal Build System
highlights.description: I was responsible for developing a build system as a proof of concept. The main idea was to develop an integrated build system to automate some processes related to daily work with C++ and python projects and units. Technologies: python, virtualenv, waf, waftools.

highlights.title: Ground Segment of SAOCOM (SAR Observation & Communications Satellite) satellite mission
highlights.description: I was working as C++ and Python developer for CONAE, The Argentinean Aerospacial Agency. My job was the designing and development of software components in diverse space related units. Most of the work was performed in a Linux enviroment using C++ and Python. Technologies: C++, C++0x, Boost, gdb, linux, cmake, gtest, django, python, jenkins, jira Units handled: VexDemux, Merger, Antenna Angle Translator and Zodiac Simulator, Satellite TC & TM Simulator, Pass Plan Processor and ExtensionViewer.

work.summary: I have worked for Arris as a member of WHS Core Team. I was responsible for maintaining and developing new features on a legacy system written in C++, mainly on the internationalization module. Technologies: C++, gdb, window, linux, remote environments, media player, gateway, icu4, sqlite3, make, gtest.

highlights.title: ULearn
highlights.description: I worked hourly in this startup as a developer. Ulearn is a platform to take courses online. Technologies: MEAN.io stack, javascript, git, bitbucket and bugheard. Reference: facundomartinmunoz@gmail.com.

highlights.title: Sivasdescalzo
highlights.description: I worked in this project for Koodu Software as a developer. I integrated this application with MRW platform using web services. Technologies: java, openbravo ERP, bitbucket and mercurial. Referece: salvador.zapata@gmail.com

highlights.title: Retails POS
highlights.description: I worked in this project for Koodu Software as a developer. I fixed some issues and bugs. Technologies: java, javascript, openbravo, bitbucket and mercurial. Referece: salvador.zapata@gmail.com

highlights.title: MSS-Report
highlights.description: I participated in the development of this private project not only as a developer but also as TL and SM. MSS-Report is a web platform that manages and synchronizes the information of specific accounts of Amazon and Channel Advisor using their respective APIs. Technologies: MySQL, JS, HTML5, CSS3, Bootstrap, Spring, Maven, JEE, Amazon, Amazon Marketplace Web Service, ChannelAdvisor, JUnit, Scrum, Jmeter, SOAP, Bitbucket.

highlights.title: SDCA
highlights.description: I developed the first part of this project. SDCA is a web system that allows the management of a large flow of information relating to the contingency of boats. It uses web services to communicate with other systems and integrates with SAP. Technologies: JEE, spring, SOAP, SAP PI, JS, Boostrap, HTML5, CSS3, JUnit, SQL Server, Jira, Bitbucket, scrum

work.summary: Object Oriented design and development, mainly in C++ using Agile methodologies. Member of Taller Technologies’ Special Projects Division.

highlights.title: Namecheck
highlights.description: tool for static checking of symbol names using configurable rules for C and C++ code implemented as a GCC plugin. Accomplishments: design, implementation and testing of the plugin, responsible for the internationalization and configurations rules, deep knowledge on GCC internals. Technologies: c++03, c++11, GCC, GDB, GNU Gettext library, valgrind, astyle, gtest, gmock, Hg.

highlights.title: tmock
highlights.description: System for mocking C code. It allows the development of test cases for functions using instrumentation on the GCC AST (GENERIC-GIMPLE). Accomplishments: exploring and analyze the source code of gcc, proof of concept on GENERIC and GIMPLE levels and knowledge on AST tree and internal structures of gcc (Handling and clone AST nodes). Technologies: gdb, valgrind, astyle, gtest, bash script, gcc (compiler and source for debbug)

highlights.title: GNC
highlights.description: embedded system of control, navigation and guidance of unmanned aircraft, part of the SARA project (Robotic Air System Argentino). Accomplishments: Knowledge on embedded systems, Research, analysis and bug fixing Research the Lab Jack hardware and protocol, Design, implementation and testing of the LabJack driver, Extending the golem compiler parser. Functional tests and debug on specific hardware. Technologies: C++, X-Plane, MavLink, TMS570, LPC1768, MATLAB simulink, UNIX, adamgree, code composer, CAN Aerospace, Pivotal, ReviewBoard, gtest, gmock, astyle, QGroundControl, Jenkins.

work.summary: I started writing a thesis as a researcher student in Bioengineering. Once I have finished it, I continued in collaboration with this Non-Profit Organization. Accomplishments: writing a thesis on Bioengineering (availble in Spanish), publishing two papers in a national conference on Bioengineering, participation in different FuDePAN projects, always using C++ as main programming language and the GNU toolchain.
